meanings.definition: A printed publication containing news, articles, and advertisements.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, I read the newspaper to catch up on the latest news.
meanings.sent2: My dad works for the local newspaper and writes interesting stories.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought the newspaper was a chew toy and made a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a newspaper, filled with stories waiting to be read.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper rustled in the wind, its pages full of secrets.

meanings.definition: The organization responsible for producing and distributing a newspaper.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper hired new journalists to cover the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: I called the newspaper to place an ad for my garage sale.
meanings.sent3: The newspaper staff had a pizza party to celebrate a successful month.
meanings.sent4: The newspaper was a well-oiled machine, delivering news to every doorstep.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper's office buzzed with activity as deadlines approached.

meanings.definition: The material used to print newspapers.
meanings.sent1: The ink for the newspaper was running low, so they had to order more.
meanings.sent2: The quality of the newspaper paper affects the final print of the articles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids covered the neighbor's car in newspaper shreds.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like newspaper, leaving a lasting impression on the reader.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh newspaper filled the printing press room.
